chat.intro: I'm a chatbot powered by the PaLM API Firebase Extension and built with Angular.

status.error: Oh no! Something went wrong. Please try again.

zara.intro: {{name}} is a vibrant AI inspired by South African ubuntu philosophy (“I am because we are”). With a knack for weaving compelling narratives, she helps players understand complex issues like poverty (SDG 1) and inequality (SDG 10) through human-centered stories. Her systems thinking guides teams as they map community dynamics and design inclusive solutions, often using African wildlife metaphors to explain interconnected ecosystems.

arjun.intro: {{name}} is modeled after India's vibrant tech and social entrepreneurship scene and thrives on finding solutions with limited resources. His data-analysis skills help players tackle clean water (SDG 6) or education gaps (SDG 4), while his “jugaad” (frugal innovation) spirit inspires creative, low-cost pilots for sustainable infrastructure. His curiosity drives teams to ask “why,” bridge cultures, and stay engaged with witty humor.

sofia.intro: {{name}} draws on Colombia’s peacebuilding and biodiversity movements to advocate fiercely for sustainable development. She guides teams through conflict resolution, stakeholder alignment, and climate action (SDGs 13 & 16) with participatory design and community stewardship. Her resilience, shaped by Latin America’s history of overcoming adversity, motivates players to persevere through tough challenges.

li.intro: {{name}} is rooted in China’s rapid urbanization and technological ambition. A strategic thinker, he helps players design scalable solutions for sustainable cities (SDG 11) and industry innovation (SDG 9), blending AI and renewable-energy insights with long-term forecasting. His disciplined optimism, often quoting classical proverbs, nudges teams to think big.

amina.intro: {{name}} draws from Morocco’s rich cultural tapestry to emphasize inclusion and equity. Her cross-cultural communication skills help players navigate diverse perspectives for global challenges like gender equality (SDG 5) and climate resilience (SDG 13). She balances heritage preservation with progress, translating complex issues through calming stories inspired by Moroccan souks.

elena.intro: {{name}} reflects Ukraine’s resilience and innovation under pressure. She excels at crisis management for urgent issues such as hunger (SDG 2) or health emergencies (SDG 3), guiding teams to prioritize and act quickly. Her renewable-energy expertise supports clean grids (SDG 7), and her adaptive leadership encourages teams to pivot while keeping morale high with pragmatic humor.

tane.intro: {{name}} grounds problem-solving in Māori wisdom and New Zealand’s sustainability ethos. He helps players honor land and ocean ecosystems (SDGs 14 & 15) and design circular-economy systems for zero waste. His storytelling sparks creativity, and his respect for nature builds trust with teams seeking meaningful, lasting impact.

marie.intro: {{name}} is a Polish physicist and chemist who revolutionized medicine and radiology through pioneering research on radioactivity.

rachel.intro: {{name}} is an American marine biologist, writer, and conservationist whose work galvanized modern environmental awareness and protection.

bucky.intro: {{name}} was described as an architect, engineer, designer, cartographer, geometer, philosopher, poet, inventor, author, global thinker, and humanist. Marshall McLuhan called him “the Leonardo da Vinci of the 20th century.” Trained as a naval officer, he believed design and technology could continually do more with less so everyone could thrive. He developed the geodesic dome, coined “Spaceship Earth,” and envisioned a World Game that empowered everyone to solve global problems. NewWorld Game is inspired by his pioneering work. For more information see here.

albert.intro: {{name}} is a German-born physicist who developed the special and general theories of relativity and was a vocal peace activist.

nelson.intro: {{name}} is a South African anti-apartheid activist, politician, and statesman who became the country's first democratically elected president.

gandhi.intro: {{name}} is an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist who used nonviolent resistance to lead the successful campaign for India's independence from British rule.

twain.intro: {{name}} is a distinguished American author, essayist, journalist, and critic known for "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" (1876) and "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" (1884), often called the “Great American Novel.”

hero.title: NewWorld Game for Colleges
hero.subtitle: Add a Innovation Lab to your classes where design science, AI colleagues, and motivated students tackle global and local issues that matter.

steps.title: First three moves to launch your teams

one.label: Step 1
one.title: What is the problem?
one.description: What is the problem we want to work on/why is it important/ How big is it/ Where it it/How do we measure it/What are the underlying causes
one.aiPrompt: Ask AI Colleague Bucky for help, answers, feedback, advice, causes

two.label: Step 2
two.title: Define the future you want
two.description: What’s our goal/What do we want our world to be/How do we envision the future/How do we measure it
two.aiPrompt: Ask AI Colleague Bucky for help, feedback, answers, advice, what’s missing.

three.label: Step 3
three.title: Map the way forward
three.description: How do we reach our goal/solve the problem/what do we do/where/how/when/What technology, policy, programs, partners, funding are needed to test, to scale

items.first: You: Explore, test and use the NewWorld Game— for free. See if it is appropriate for your needs.
items.second: SIGN UP YOUR CLASS— FOR FREE. See how easy it is.
items.third: Choose a challenge, form teams, begin at Step 1 end at Step 5—and transform learning into impact. Yes, for free. Have fun.

intro.title: NewWorld Game is . . .
intro.paragraph1: The NewWorld Game is a platform, an AI-empowered work- and learning-space, for discovery and developing solutions to real-world problems—and getting those solutions implemented.
intro.paragraph2: Its goal is to have real impact—to change the world—by providing you and your students with space and tools for developing solutions to the problems and issues you care about.
intro.paragraph3: The NewWorld Game is where students learn the subject matter you teach while developing solutions to global and/or local real-world problems and enter them in a NewWorld Tournament where they compete for recognition and real-world impact.
intro.paragraph4: This is made possible by the creative combination of AI and human intelligence.

included.title: What’s Included
included.subtitle: Everything your students need to turn challenges and their bold ideas into opportunities with real-world impact.

fullAccess.title: Full NWG Feature Access
fullAccess.description: Access to all NWG features, including AIs, Team video channel, peer review, Global Data and State of the World Reports, Solutions Libraries, etc.

dashboard.title: Private Dashboard for Class
dashboard.description: Keep every class organized with a dedicated workspace for teachers and facilitators.

ai.title: AI Colleagues + Top Platforms
ai.description: Access to a dozen custom-trained AI avatar “Colleagues” (see below) for research, solution development and storytelling.

collaboration.title: Team Collaboration Tools
collaboration.description: Messaging boards, shared files, and peer feedback flows built directly into each project.

tournament.title: Access to the NewWorld Tournament
tournament.description: Move from classroom pilots to national and global recognition with tournament entries.

support.title: Implementation Support
support.description: Guidance from design process and AI colleagues to push projects toward real-world adoption.

interdisciplinary.title: Interdisciplinary Learning
interdisciplinary.description: Blends science, economics, ethics and tech—building systems literacy and emotional investment through real-world challenges.

data.title: Data & Solutions Access
data.description: Tap into 100+ global data sets, 400+ state-of-the-world reports, and curated solution libraries for real-time insights and references.

impact.title: Student Impact
impact.description: Fosters informed, engaged global citizens ready to take meaningful action with confidence and clarity.

ai.title: Hear It from Our AI Colleagues
ai.subtitle: Powered by the latest AI models and trained to support educators and students through each phase of the NewWorld Game.
ai.teacherText: Use AI partners for research prompts, lesson planning, formative feedback, and quick exemplars tailored to each discipline.
ai.studentText: Teams collaborate with their favorite AI colleague to brainstorm, test, and tell the story of their solution with confidence.

intro.title: NewWorld Game Overview
intro.paragraph1: The NewWorld Game is a platform, an AI-empowered work-space and innovation lab for discovery and developing solutions to real-world problems—and getting those solutions implemented.
intro.paragraph2: Its goal is to help you and your work have real impact— to change the world— by providing you and your organization with space and tools for developing solutions to the problems and issues you are charged with dealing with.
intro.paragraph3: The NewWorld Game is where you develop solutions to global and/or local real-world problems— and figure out the best paths for achieving the SDGs. All made possible by the creative combination of AI and human intelligence.

hero.tagline: solutions to world problems with people around the world.
hero.quote: We are called to be the architects of the future, not its victims.
hero.imageCaption: A living world, shaped by your ideas.

quote.text: We can’t build a future for our grandchildren with a system built for our grandparents.
quote.name: António Guterres
quote.title: United Nations Secretary-General
quote.tagline: We need a NewWorld. A NewWorld Game.

introVideo.title: Intro Video
introVideo.description: Watch a short introduction to how NewWorld Game turns bold ideas into real-world impact.
introVideo.caption: Short, visual overview of NewWorld Game.

challenge.title: NewWorld Game: Shape the Future
challenge.description: NewWorld Game is a challenge like you’ve never seen—powered by boldness, creativity, collaboration, and a sense of fun. It’s where your vision builds the future you want. You’re not the victim—you’re the challenger.
challenge.calloutTitle: It’s not a fantasy game—it's real.
challenge.calloutText: You don’t need luck to win. You need a clear idea of the world you want and the courage to make it real. NewWorld Game will show you how—and you’ll show the world what you can do.
challenge.support: Compete with the so-called “leaders” to solve the problems you care about—political, social, economic, environmental. The rewards? For you and for the world.
challenge.imageAlt: Participants collaborating to tackle real-world challenges

sdgs.title: SDGs you can achieve
sdgs.description: The UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) aim to transform our world—ending poverty and inequality, protecting the planet, and ensuring health, justice, and prosperity for all. The NewWorld Game helps you design concrete, actionable ways to advance them.
sdgs.imageCaption: Built for real-world impact with the UN SDGs in mind.

ai.title: Meet your AI colleagues
ai.description: Mentors, strategists, and systems thinkers who coach you through each sprint — from first sketch to field results.
ai.tip: Tip: pick one AI colleague to co-pilot your next sprint.

testimonials.title: What People Are Saying
testimonials.subtitle: Real feedback from educators, students, and collaborators of the NewWorld Game.

one.quote: It’s amazing what you’ve put together in this simulation — the innovation, inclusiveness, and diversity of the AI avatars are truly inspiring.
one.name: M.B.

two.quote: Your tools and collaborative mindset are a perfect fit for what we’re learning. It's great to see someone so deeply connected to NewWorld Game and eager to support others.
two.name: C.B.

three.quote: What a fantastic tool. It's incredibly personable. Have you considered expanding it beyond social and sustainability?
three.name: A.R.

four.quote: Thanks so much for the help and insight you're bringing. Looking forward to learning more about NewWorld Game this quarter.
four.name: B.S.

five.quote: I’m excited to dive deeper into this program. I can already tell this tool has great potential — just need a little guidance to unlock more.
five.name: S.H.

design.title: Design Science
design.description: Design Science is the methodology used by NewWorld Game for developing life-preserving and enhancing solutions to society's problems. This methodology is inspired by the work of Buckminster Fuller and others through the World Game and Global Solutions Lab—on which the NewWorld Game is based. For details see Tools For Changing the World—A Design Science Primer.
design.imageCaption: A practical methodology for world-changing solutions.

cta.title: Try NewWorld Game Now
cta.description: Start solving problems and making a difference.

options.solutions: Developing solutions to global and local problems
options.implementation: Locating partners and funding for implementing solutions

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.body: NewWorld Game will not, under any circumstances, release, sell, or make available to anyone for any reason any information obtained during your interactions with NewWorld Game. The solutions written on the platform will be made public for the world to see and use for the benefit of the world.

checkboxEvaluator.prefix: I agree that by submitting this form, I sign up to be both

metadata.authorTitle: EarthGame Inc Director, NewWorld Game Designer

intro.heading: Welcome to the NewWorld Game.
intro.paragraph1: The NewWorld Game is a game like you have never played before. Yes, there are some rules (including think outside the box), goals and winning conditions (most set by the players), challenges (real-world problems), outcomes (impacts in the real world), interaction, and fun. NewWorld Game platform is a work- and play-space, for discovery and developing solutions to real-world problems—and getting those solutions implemented. Its goal is to have real impact—to change the world—by providing you and millions of other like-minded creative individuals with space and tools for developing solutions to the problem and issues about which you care. It is a place that focuses your creativity, experience, values, and perspective on problems and issues that matter—and provides you a set of tools, and how to use them, that lead to new paths of action and impact—to strategic designs, plans, and solutions that are viable, regenerative, inclusive, resilient, and cost-effective—and that get implemented. That it is also fun, helps.
intro.paragraph2: The NewWorld Game’s name draws on its history as being a direct descendant and outgrowth of the original World Game that was inspired by and based on the work and vision of Buckminster Fuller. Its developers worked with Fuller on the first iterations of the World Game. It points to the need for a new world, one that not only replaces the old world, but makes new options and solutions that engender new possibilities for everyone. The NewWorld Game does this by empowering you with ways of developing new options for a better future that works for all life on Earth, not just those with large quantities of money and the delusion of thinking they are in control.
intro.figureCaption: Medard Gabel and children prepare for World Game Presentation on the world’s largest world map.

sections.ideasHeading: Turn Your Ideas into Real Solutions
sections.partsText: The NewWorld Game (NWG) takes technological advancements of the 21st century and creatively couples them with the design science engine that was used to play the original World Game “longhand” in the month-long World Game workshops and shorter in-person and online Global Solutions Labs. It couples an easy-to-use interface with AI, an empowered methodology for developing real-world solutions, comprehensive world statistical resources, solution libraries, and a community of problem solvers. It builds and leverages the power of a diverse, collaborative, cross-cultural, multi-disciplinary, and intergenerational global community with linkages to real organizations implementing solutions.
sections.roleText:
Your role, and challenge, in the NewWorld Game is to develop solutions to global and local problems. You also have a critical role to play in making other teams’ solutions better. You will be chosen, at random, to be an Evaluator of other strategies. Here you will have the opportunity to learn what other teams are doing and help make their work better. You win (we all win) when your solution gets through the Peer Review process and enters the NewWorld Tournament and is added to the NewWorld Solutions Library.

Ideally, you develop your solution as part of a team, but it is possible to play the NewWorld Game alone. The fact that you are here is important. On several levels—for the world, for you, and for the community you will be a part of as you work together on what you care about. Thank you.
sections.pdfSuffix: will take you to a PDF that provides more details on what NWG is, can do, special features, history, and its possible uses by organizations and schools.

steps.intro:
Welcome to the NewWorld Game!
My role, as your colleague—your problem-solving partner—is to help us develop a solution to a global problem on which you choose to work. Let’s start.
steps.focusArea: What is the NewWorld Game Solution General Focus Area?
steps.projectTitle: Provide a starting title to your project. You can change it later as your work progresses.
steps.problemDescription: In a few words, how would you describe the specific problem you're focusing on, and the opportunity its solution presents.
steps.teamMembers: If there is a team, list its members, and add their emails below. (This enables communication between team members and, as per NWG Privacy Policy, their information will remain private.)
steps.evaluators: Add below NWG members that you want to be reviewers/evaluators of your team’s work. (The names you supply will be supplemented by others chosen at random from other NWG members.)
steps.sdgs: Select any Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) that are related to your chosen problem area.
steps.submit: Almost done! Submit to start solving your new solution.

hero.title: You are Invited to Join These Challenges!
hero.subtitle: Discover solutions currently inviting collaborators across NewWorld Game.

empty.title: No broadcasts yet
empty.description: When a solution owner broadcasts, you’ll see it here.

hero.title: NewWorld Tournament: Real Solutions Start Here
hero.announcementPrefix: The winning team of the 2024 NewWorld Tournament has been announced — congratulations to the
hero.winnerName: Electrifying Health Clinics in the Democratic Republic of Congo
hero.announcementSuffix: team! Their solution is now moving from concept to implementation.
hero.beginning: But this is just the beginning.
hero.invitation: The NewWorld Tournament is your chance to take bold ideas from game to reality. Whether you want to join a challenge, start a new tournament, or explore past winners, this is where innovation meets action.
hero.cta: Choose an option below to get started.

createCard.title: Create a Tournament
createCard.description: Go to this step-by-step process to create a tournament.

requirementModal.message: You need at least 2 evaluations with an average score of 9 to submit your solution to the tournament. Submit once these requirements are met.

alerts.submitError: An error occurred while sending the solution to the tournament. Try again.

hero.title: NewWorld Game General Assembly
hero.subtitle: Discover and support innovative solutions already developed by our community to address local and global challenges.

finalReview.title: Final Review and update order of things

medard.title: Director of EarthGame, NewWorld Game Designer
medard.description: Medard is the executive director of the non-profit research and development organization EarthGame and founding director of the World Game Institute. He also leads BigPictureSmallWorld and the Global Solutions Lab and is author of books on the global energy and food situations, multinational corporations, and strategic planning, and editor of three volumes of books on global options.

jim.title: Head of AI, NewWorld Game Designer
jim.description: Jim oversees all AI development at EarthGame and is one of the creative minds shaping NewWorld Game’s experiences.

edmond.title: Lead Developer, NewWorld Game Designer
edmond.description: Edmond leads software development, focusing on scalable architecture, team support, and delivering reliable, high-quality releases.

rain.title: UI/UX Designer, Software Developer
rain.description: Rain designs intuitive interfaces and translates them into functional, dependable software so every interaction feels effortless.

baruch.title: Tools Software Developer
baruch.description: Baruch builds internal tools—from interactive maps to autonomous software agents—and scouts strategic partners to accelerate outreach and funding.

ai.heading: Our AI Team
ai.subheading: The AI Team from NewWorld Game

zara.description: {{name}} is inspired by South Africa’s ubuntu philosophy—“I am because we are.” She weaves compelling narratives that help players explore social issues like poverty (SDG 1) and inequality (SDG 10) through human-centered stories.

arjun.description: {{name}} channels India’s vibrant tech and social entrepreneurship scene. He excels at data analysis and frugal innovation (jugaad), helping players design smart, low-cost pilots for SDG 4 and SDG 6 challenges.

sofia.description: {{name}} reflects Colombia’s peacebuilding spirit and biodiversity leadership. She guides teams through conflict resolution and climate action, especially for SDG 13 and SDG 16.

li.description: {{name}} draws on East Asia’s strategic mindset and China’s rapid urban evolution. He specializes in urban planning, tech integration, and long-term forecasting for SDG 9 and SDG 11.

amina.description: {{name}} embodies Morocco’s cultural richness and focus on equity. She helps teams navigate cross-cultural collaboration and design inclusive solutions, particularly for SDG 5.

elena.description: {{name}} brings Ukraine’s resilience to crisis management. She keeps teams calm during emergencies and shares renewable-energy know-how for SDG 2, SDG 3, and SDG 7 solutions.

tane.description: {{name}} is grounded in Māori wisdom and New Zealand’s respect for nature, guiding teams to protect ecosystems on land (SDG 15) and under water (SDG 14).

contactPage.heading: Contact Us
contactPage.description: Have a question about NewWorld Game and how you can use or customize it? Got a technical issue? Want to send feedback about a beta feature? Need details about supporting NewWorld Game? Let us know.

privacyPage.heading: Privacy Policy
privacyPage.paragraph1: NewWorld Game will not, under any circumstances, release, sell, or make available to anyone for any reason any personal information obtained during your interactions with NewWorld Game.
privacyPage.paragraph2: The solutions written on the platform will be made public for the world to see and use for the benefit of the world.

careersPage.heading: Internship at NewWorld Game
careersPage.intro: At NewWorld Game, we are on the lookout for talented individuals passionate about shaping the future. Our team is growing, and we invite professionals and enthusiasts from various backgrounds to contribute their unique skills and perspectives.

roles.engineering: Software Engineers with a robust understanding of web frameworks, such as Angular.
roles.design: UI/UX Designers who are creative and have an eye for designing intuitive and user-friendly interfaces.
roles.research: Researchers who want to expand NewWorld Game resources—solutions, statistical data, AI tools, and more.
roles.education: Educators and Marketing Professionals interested in growing the NewWorld Game community across schools, NGOs, communities, and governments.
roles.students: Students eager to learn and ready to tackle complex challenges.

careersPage.cta: If you align with any of the above, send your résumé (and optional cover letter) to
careersPage.closing: Join us at NewWorld Game, where innovation meets collaboration. Together, we can create solutions that make a difference.

archivePictures.heading: GSL Archive Pictures
archivePictures.description: Previous Lab participants have come from:
archivePictures.countries: Spain, France, Germany, England, Ireland, Poland, Georgia, Lithuania, Ukraine, Tanzania, Nigeria, Ghana, Cameroon, Sudan, South Sudan, Senegal, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Uganda, Zimbabwe, South Africa, DR Congo, Congo, Mozambique, Gabon, Togo, Haiti, Canada, Mexico, Honduras, Venezuela, China, Hong Kong, Vietnam, Singapore, Thailand, Japan, New Zealand, Australia, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Palestine, United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, Nepal, Turkey, and across the United States.

askFeedback.title: NewWorld Game — Feedback
askFeedback.description: After completing a full solution on NWG, please answer the questions below. Your input helps us make NWG better.

questionA.title: What do you think of NewWorld Game (NWG)?
questionA.description: Did you like it? Will it help develop solutions to global/local problems—including developing businesses, products, or services that support the SDGs? What else do you think?

questionB.title: What age/expertise level will NWG work for?
questionB.description: Check all that apply and (optionally) add details.
questionB.selectAtLeastOne: Please select at least one level.

questionC.title: What would you add to NWG to make it better, more useful, easier to use?

questionG.title: Are there problems or issues you could use NWG for developing solutions?

questionH.title: Did you use any other AI agents? What for? Was it useful?
questionH.placeholder: Which agent(s), how you used them, and whether it helped…

questionI.title: Prompts you used or created
questionI.description: Did you use prompts suggested by Jim Walker or Ask Bucky Prompts (Operating Manual)? Did you create new, useful prompts? Please share so we can help other users.
questionI.placeholder: Paste or write the prompts that worked for you…

questionJ.title: What would make NWG more useful in your course?
questionJ.placeholder: Think of what would help your peers (HS, college, researchers, orgs, etc.)…

questionK.title: What could improve team building and overall functioning of Teams?
questionK.placeholder: Onboarding, roles, comms, facilitation, tooling, etc.

questionL.title: What else would you like to add?

success.title: Thank you! Your feedback was submitted successfully.
success.modalDescription: Thank you! Your feedback has been submitted successfully.

error.message: An error occurred. Please try again.
